text: [Music]
hey guys what's up and walks back to my
channel I hope you all are doing great
I've been seeing these unicorn cakes and
macarons all over Instagram and as soon
as I saw them I knew that I wanted to
make a phone case as I like it so today
I'm going to be making a unicorn phone
case from scratch it's been quite a
while since I've done a silicone phone
case video but you could totally also
make this phone case using a clear one
so I hope you guys enjoy the video if
you do enjoy it be sure to give it a big
thumbs up and if you argue to my channel
and if you could make me click that
subscribe button that would be so so
awesome and also by the time this video
is up I'm pretty sure that there will be
a new vlog up on my second channel so if
you would like to watch that I will
leave a link for it down below and now
without any further ado let's get
started with the unicorn phone case to
make your own phone case from scratch
you will need silicone and cornstarch I
got both of these items from Walmart in
a bowl I'm going to take out some
cornstarch then I'm going to take the
silicone and squeeze out a very good
amount of it make sure that you put all
of this in one area because you don't
want this to go all over the place so
what I did is I'm going to sprinkle some
cornstarch on top of the silicone that
way it's not going to stick on to my
hands and as you can see I am wearing a
pair of gloves because silicone is super
sticky so you want to make sure that you
wear gloves when you do this anyway
basically what I'm doing is I'm kind of
kneading it into the cornstarch and as
soon as you start doing that it will get
less stickier and eventually form into a
dough like consistency so it's at the
point where it is sticky but it's not
sticking on to my hands that's the
consistency you want
to roll it out I placed a piece of
parchment paper and two popsicle sticks
on the side and now I'm just going to
roll this out as evenly as I can the
popsicle sticks will help you get an
even thickness this is a super important
step before you start putting the dough
on top of your phone you do want to
protect it so I have some cling wrap and
I'm going to basically just wrap my
phone using the cling wrap
I also added in a piece of paper that
has an arrow on it that way I know where
is like the top of the phone and where's
the bottom
[Music]
now you can start covering the phone
using the doh this is so easy to do all
I'm doing is I'm kind of blending it in
with my fingers and shaping it
accordingly
so yeah this step is kind of
self-explanatory you can pretty much see
what I'm doing by the way as I mentioned
earlier you do not have to make your own
phone case for this you could also use a
clear one so just throwing it out there
that if you don't want to do all of this
you totally don't have to so I did save
a little bit of the dough and I'm going
to make the ears so I made two triangle
shapes and I'm just going to add those
on if you do end up using a clear phone
case you can also use polymer clay or
air dry clay to make the ears
once that's done you want to let this
air dry for about 24 hours and yes that
does mean that you cannot use your phone
till then now to make the sprinkles I'm
using polymer clay and what I'm going to
do is roll out thin snakes of the clay
and just cut it into small little pieces
[Music]
[Music]
once you're all done let us bake in the
oven for about five minutes for the horn
I'm using gold polymer clay and I'm kind
of twisting it into a horn-like shape so
it's flat at the bottom and then the top
is pointy
[Music]
let that also bake in the oven for about
15 minutes now back to the phone case
once it's completely dry go ahead with
an exacto knife and cut off any extra
silicone so like I'm doing here I'm just
carefully cutting it and kind of shaping
the phone case from the back I'm going
to carefully take out the phone and this
is like the moment of truth every single
time I make a silicone phone case I'm
always so scared but luckily it turned
out pretty nice
then you want to go ahead and cut the
areas for the camera hole and the
charger so I just did that off-camera it
was pretty easy using gold acrylic paint
I'm going to add in the details inside
the ears
[Music]
using some superglue I'm going to glue
on the horn and the sprinkles using
black acrylic paint I'm adding in the
eyes I did kind of mess up one eye so
that I took my exacto knife and I kind
of scraped it off it worked perfectly
fine so luckily I was able to save it
and yeah now I'm just adding in the
eyelashes and then to finish it off I
took a little bit of chalk pastel and
I'm adding the blush you could also use
like a regular makeup blush if you would
like
[Music]
and there is your completed unicorn
phone case I really hope you guys
enjoyed this video and I hope you all
are having a fantastic day I love you so
much and I will see you in my next one
